description: Blog Post Summaries on Main Page - Auto-extract plain-text summaries from blog post content at build time and display them on the main listing page

userStories.title: Generate summaries at build time
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the build script to extract a plain-text summary from each blog post so that summary data is available in blog-index.json without runtime fetching.
acceptanceCriteria: generate-blog-index.js reads each markdown file's content
Strips all markdown syntax (headings, links, bold, code, images, etc.) to produce plain text
Extracts the first ~150 characters, truncating at a word boundary
Appends an ellipsis ('...') when the text is truncated
Adds a summary field to each entry in blog-index.json
Existing fields (slug, title, date, path) remain unchanged

userStories.title: Display summary on blog listing page
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want to see a short summary under each blog post title so I can decide which posts to read.
acceptanceCriteria: Each post in the blog list shows the summary text below the title and date
Summary is rendered as plain text (no markdown/HTML)
Summary is visually styled to be secondary to the title (smaller or lighter text)
Layout remains clean and readable on mobile and desktop
Gracefully handles posts with no summary (empty content) â€” shows title/date only
Verify summaries are visible in browser using agent-browser skill

userStories.title: Update tests for summary functionality
userStories.description: As a developer, I want tests updated to cover the new summary functionality so regressions are caught.
acceptanceCriteria: generate-blog-index.js tests verify summary extraction and truncation
BlogList component tests verify summary rendering
All existing tests continue to pass
